qas.question: Which dynasty ruled Tibet through a top-level administrative department?
Who was the political authority of the region?
Who held administrative and military power?
What was one of the Mongol Yuan department's purposes?
What is the Yuan term for the Bureau of Buddhist and Tibetan Affairs?
What did the Mongol lama retain?
What did Mongol rule of China remain separate from?
What troops did the Sayka lama have the authority to send?

context: The <a0_0>Mongol Yuan<a0_0/> dynasty, through the Bureau of Buddhist and Tibetan Affairs, or <b6_0>Xuanzheng Yuan<b6_0/>, ruled Tibet through a top-level administrative department. One of the department's purposes was <b5_0>to select a dpon-chen<b5_0/> ('<a1_0>great administrator<a1_0/>'), usually appointed by the lama and confirmed by the <a2_0>Mongol emperor<a2_0/> in Beijing. The <a3_0>Sakya lama<a3_0/> retained <b7_0>a degree of autonomy<b7_0/>, acting as the political authority of the region, while the <a4_0>dpon-chen<a4_0/> held administrative and military power. Mongol rule of Tibet remained separate from <b8_0>the main provinces<b8_0/> of China, but the region existed under the administration of the Yuan dynasty. If the Sakya lama ever came into conflict with the dpon-chen, the dpon-chen had the authority to send <b9_0>Chinese<b9_0/> troops into the region.
